 # Maven module containing schema plugins
 
-## Plugin structure
+## Schema Plugin Definition
 
-A schema plugin is composed off:
+* `src/main/plugin/<folder>` plugin contents:
+   
+  * `schema-ident.xml` configuration file
+  * schema definition `xsd` files
+  * transformations `xsl` files
+  * See [GeoNetwork Manual](https://geonetwork-opensource.org/manuals/trunk/en/customizing-application/implementing-a-schema-plugin.html)
 
-* A configuration folder containing XML file for configuration,
-the schema as XSDs and a set of transformation (See http://geonetwork-opensource.org/manuals/trunk/eng/developer/schemaPlugins/index.html).
+* `src/main/java` providing:
+  
+  * Optional: SchemaPlugin bean
+  * Optional: ApplicationListener<ServerStartup> to auto install plugin
 
-* (optional) A SchemaPlugin bean
+## Recommended: Artifact unpack
 
+1. Be sure your plugin includes `src/main/plugin`.
 
-## Add a plugin to the build
+2. Use `mvn install` to install your schema plugin in your local repository.
 
-To include a new schema plugin in a build, copy the schema folder
-here and add it to the copy-schemas execution in web/pom.xml.
+3. Add a profile to `web/pom.xml` unpacking your schema plugin.
+   
+   ```xml
+    <profile>
+      <id>hnap</id>
+      <build>
+        <plugins>
+          <plugin>
+            <groupId>org.apache.maven.plugins</groupId>
+            <artifactId>maven-dependency-plugin</artifactId>
+            <dependencies>
+              <dependency>
+                <groupId>${project.groupId}</groupId>
+                <artifactId>schema-iso19139.ca.HNAP</artifactId>
+                <version>${gn.schemas.version>}</version>
+              </dependency>
+            </dependencies>
+            <executions>
+              <execution>
+                <id>iso19139.ca.HNAP-resources</id>
+                <phase>process-resources</phase>
+                <goals><goal>unpack</goal></goals>
+                <configuration>
+                  <encoding>UTF-8</encoding>
+                  <artifactItems>
+                    <artifactItem>
+                      <groupId>org.geonetwork-opensource</groupId>
+                      <artifactId>schema-iso19139.ca.HNAP</artifactId>
+                      <version>${gn.schemas.version>}</version>
+                      <type>jar</type>
+                      <overWrite>false</overWrite>
+                      <outputDirectory>${basedir}/src/main/webapp/WEB-INF/data/config/schema_plugins</outputDirectory>
+                      <includes>src/main/plugin</includes>
+                    </artifactItem>
+                  </artifactItems>
+                </configuration>
+              </execution>
+            </executions>
+          </plugin>
+        </plugins>
+      </build>
+    </profile>
+   ```
 
+4. Use your profile, for example `mvn process-resources -Phnap`, to extract plugin from artifact during build.
+
+## Option: Fork and add a plugin to the build
+
+To include a new schema plugin in a build:
+
+1. Add schema plugin:
+   
+   * As a git submodule if you are making a fork
+   * As a folder, using `.gitignore` to avoid accidentally commiting.
+`
+2. Use a profile (activated by your folder being present) to include your schema plugin to the list of modules in `pom.xml`.
+   
+   ```xml
+   <profiles>
+     <profile>
+       <id>hnap</id>
+       <activation>
+       <file>
+         <exists>iso19139.ca.HNAP</exists>
+       </file>
+       </activation>
+       <modules>
+         <module>iso19139.ca.HNAP</module>
+       </modules>
+     </profile>
+   </profiles>
+   ```
+
+3. Add your schema to the `copy-schemas` execution in `web/pom.xml`.
+   
+   ```xml
+   <resource>
+     <directory>${project.basedir}/../schemas/iso19139.ca.HNAP/src/main/plugin</directory>
+     <targetPath>${basedir}/src/main/webapp/WEB-INF/data/config/schema_plugins
+     </targetPath>
+   </resource>
+   ```
+
+4. Use `mvn process-resoruces -Dcopy` to activate `copy-schemas` execution.

I understand about .m2 modification to list activeProfiles not working for you.

Use active by default (this does not work across teams)
Use of settings.xml

If you must fork I would prefer if you fork and add:
    <activation>
      <activeByDefault>true</activeByDefault>
    </activation>

To your required profiles.
However I would like to check if the work I have done already takes away this need?

Checkout the metadata101 plugins you need to into schemas folder
Make sure they are added to a schemas/.gitignore to avoid accidentally commiting
A profile in schemas/pom.xml will check for the folder being present and include the module
A profile in web/pom.xml will check for the folder being present and include the dependency and unpack the artifact

This should address the issue for you to one of initial setup, and avoid having to make any pom.xml changes to work with you desired schema plugins.

So I'm recommending that these be renamed to schemas-unpack and schemas-copy so that they are grouped next to each other in the maven toolbar.

However for these I did not want either profile used, I wanted folks to use -Dcopy=true or -Dcopy=false so only one profile enables at a time. This is a best practice for setting up either/or profiles.
I guess that is hard to manage in IntelliJ so you need to do that by hand?
